question: 台風
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>machine</kanji> that pumps <kanji>wind</kanji> can malfunction and make too much, causing a <vocabulary>typhoon</vocabulary>. It's a really powerful machine to be able to move that much wind.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. Instead of <ja>だい</ja> for <ja>台</ja> though, this uses the reading <ja>たい</ja>. Remember it like this:

When a <vocabulary>typhoon</vocabulary> is coming you have to <reading>tie</reading> (<ja>たい</ja>) down all of your stuff. Or, you know, if you already know the word typhoon, that's fine too.
